thread.title: Chinese firms buy $16bn of Nvidia's advanced artificial intelligence chips
thread.title_full: Chinese firms buy $16bn of Nvidia's advanced artificial intelligence chips

author: Louisa Clarence-Smith, US Business Editor
title: Chinese firms buy $16bn of Nvidia's advanced artificial intelligence chips
text:
Chinese firms buy $16bn of Nvidia’s advanced artificial intelligence chips ByteDance, Alibaba Group and Tencent Holdings among those ordering the most sophisticated AI semiconductors available under US export rules Louisa Clarence-Smith , US Business Editor Thursday April 03 2025, 12.01am, The Times Access to Nvidia’s high-performing chips could fuel Chinese breakthroughs in AI and computers for its military JOSH EDELSON/AFP/GETTY IMAGES Louisa Clarence-Smith , US Business Editor Thursday April 03 2025, 12.01am, The Times Chinese companies have reportedly placed at least $16 billion in orders for Nvidia’s H20 chips in the first three months of the year.
ByteDance, Alibaba Group and Tencent Holdings are among companies that have been buying up the most advanced Nvidia artificial intelligence chips that are legally available in China under US export controls, The Information reported.
The US has imposed export restrictions on Nvidia’s most advanced chips , including the Blackwell, to prevent them reaching China. AI chips designed by Nvidia are widely seen as being superior to rival products for AI work because of their capacity to more efficiently process huge amounts of data needed for machine-learning tasks. Access to the high-performing chips could fuel Chinese breakthroughs in AI and sophisticated computers for
